question.text: Which type of primer is used the genetic engineering tool -Polymerase Chain Reaction?

options.text: Complementary to  <math><mn>5</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></math>  end of DNA template.
Complementary to  <math><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></math>  end of DNA template.
Complementary to both  <math><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></math>  and  <math><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">′</mi></mrow></msup></math>  end of DNA template.

solution.text: The Taq polymerase enzyme that adds up and extends the primer follows the  <math><mn>5</mn><mi>’</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>’</mi></math>  direction for the new strand made based on the template. The template strand is the complementary of new strand/primer whose direction is opposite -  <math><mn>3</mn><mi>’</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>’</mi></math> .
